title: How to Break a Beer Bottle With Your Bare Hands

steps.title: Fill the bottle until the water is about 2 in (5 cm) from the top.
steps.content: Fill the bottle until the water is about 2 in (5 cm) from the top. The colder the water, the better, as the sudden temperature change will make the bottle break more easily. This also works with beer, which makes the trick a little more dramatic.

steps.title: Wrap the top 2 fingers of your non-dominant hand around the neck.
steps.content: Wrap the top 2 fingers of your non-dominant hand around the neck. This will prevent shards of glass from stabbing you in the palm if the entire bottle shatters. [1] X Research source Then, hit the opening of the bottle hard with your dominant hand. Check the bottom of the bottle, which should have broken right off. [2] X Research source

steps.title: The bottom of the bottle breaks off due to “cavitation.”
steps.content: The bottom of the bottle breaks off due to “cavitation.” [3] X Research source The bottle briefly and suddenly moves downward when you strike the top. The water inside of it doesn't move as quickly, creating an extremely brief void (vacuum) at the bottom. The water does catch up with the glass and comes crashing down into the bottom. If the force is great enough, the bottle can no longer support the water crashing down and cracks or breaks at the bottom. Even if the crack is minor, the inertia and weight of the water will break the bottom out of the bottle. [4] X Research source
